column4: Hi! I'm wondering if anyone has any ideas about making firefox load faster. It currently takes about 3 seconds. I tried cleaning the SQLite database using a script, but it didn't do much for me. I'm on Ubuntu 10.10.
3 seconds ain't long... It loads for like 1.5 minutes for me, hey

Ah, ok. I was thinking, like most programs such as Abiword take maybe 1.5 seconds at most, so Firefox might too. How does it take 1.5min? That seems kind of slow. Then again I'm not a particularly patient person :-P
Anyway, on Extensions Manager -> Plugins disable those you do not use, especially the "VLC Multimedia Player Plugin" (if that's there), that takes ages to load.
Ok, thanks!
As for how it takes 1.5 minutes, extensions, tons of them (like twenty). Chrome with almost same number of extensions starts up in just a few seconds though ^_^

Ah, hmm. I disabled the VLC plugin, but didn't notice much difference. Then again I have about twenty plugins and extensions too. It's funny that you say that because I switched away from Chromium because it was too slow. :-P
Huh. Weird. Okay lol
Ah, it's way faster in safe mode. Must be an extension or a plugin that's the culprit…
I suppose so.
I haven't used Firefox for a few months now, and the last one I used is Aurora anyway
lol, yup, 14 plugins
Not to mention 13 extensions. No wonder it's slow.
lol
The ridiculous list: http://pastebin.com/TYGww0UF :-D
lol
Now for going through and figuring out which ones are the culprits… :-P
lol not bad, these are mine: http://i.imm.io/eNLh.png
hehe. That looks like plenty
pm? lol
We went a bit offtopic
hmm, good point :-S
